bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to Josiah Quincy, March 30, 1893
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 21. Consulate-General U.S.A., Monrovia, Liberia, March 30, 1893.
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
No. 21. Consulate-General, U.S.A., Monrovia, Liberia, March 30, 1893.
Honorable Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.

Sir: I respectfully request of you the following supplies for use at this Consulate General:- 1 Passport Book 1 Register of Official Services to Vessels, 1 Receipt Book. 1 Protest Book. 1 Daily Journal, 1 Dispatch Book, 1 Consular Seal, 2 Letter Files
If the above are forwarded by or before June 1st, send in my name: if after that time, in the name of Beverly Y. Payne, Vice Consul General.
